intro: Urera kaalae, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus or pua kala, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Urera kaalae thrives in moist, shaded environments and is an important part of Hawaii's native flora.
